Subject: Slower-than-expected crawl Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Heritrix 3.0.0-beta
 test release now available
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=T3QSC7zW25zu25P8n0bV3s5ioE_tJNGYD_tC56XlOLbR

farbgeist wrote:
> Hi there,
> 
> I am testing the beta on my dual core 2GB RAM and 100Mb bandwidth server. We get an average URI/s of only 3.69 although I changed the default settings to 400 toe threads and 5 max-hops. Five big seed sites are used.
> What is the matter?

If you supply 5 seeds to our default configuration, the implied scope is 
URIs on those sites -- not the whole net. I suspect it's crawling those 
sites as fast as the configured politeness rules allow. (That's one 
connection per hostname at a time, with a scaled pause between requests.)

If you want a truly 'broad' crawl -- following links everywhere -- you'd 
replace the first two rules of our default configuration...

RejectDecideRule (initially rejects everything)
SurtPrefixedDecideRule (accepts URIs of certain site/path prefixes)

...with one alternate rule...

AcceptDecideRule (accepts everything)

- Gordon @ IA
